summary: Since 2016, the Department of Homeland Security has been working to replace its outdated biometric identity management system that matches fingerprints and facial features. DHS expects the new system to store hundreds of millions of identities. But the system is way behind schedule and costs more than estimated—even after readjusting the schedule and cost estimates twice. And these estimates are unreliable because DHS doesn't follow...
title: Biometric Identity System: DHS Needs to Address Significant Shortcomings in Program Management and Privacy
